TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WhiteSpaceTrimStringConverter extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationConverterBase
Public NotInheritable Class WhiteSpaceTrimStringConverter Inherits ConfigurationConverterBase

Docs.summary: Converts a string to its canonical format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This <xref:System.Configuration.WhiteSpaceTrimStringConverter> object converts between a configuration string value and its canonical representation. Canonical representation means that all white spaces are trimmed from the beginning and end of a string value.
## Examples The following code example shows how to apply <xref:System.Configuration.WhiteSpaceTrimStringConverter> to a custom string property `FileName`.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationConvertersCustomSection#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationConvertersCustomSection/CS/ConfigurationConvertersCustomSection.cs#0)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationConvertersCustomSection#0](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationConvertersCustomSection/VB/ConfigurationConvertersCustomSection.vb#0)]
The following is a configuration excerpt used by the previous example.
```xml <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <configuration>
<configSections> <section name="CustomSection" type="Samples.AspNet.CustomSection, ConfigurationConverters, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null" allowDefinition="Everywhere" allowExeDefinition="MachineToApplication" restartOnExternalChanges="true" /> </configSections>
<CustomSection fileName="default.txt" maxIdleTime="90" timeDelay="infinite" cdStr="str0, str1" permission="Read" maxUsers="Infinite"/>
</configuration> ```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Normally, you use the converter types provided by the system. The only time you need to use the <xref:System.Configuration.WhiteSpaceTrimStringConverter.%23ctor%2A> constructor is when you create your own conversion type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The system uses the <xref:System.Configuration.WhiteSpaceTrimStringConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method when reading from a configuration file to convert a <xref:System.String> value to its canonical form.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The system uses the <xref:System.Configuration.WhiteSpaceTrimStringConverter.ConvertTo%2A> method when writing to a configuration file to convert a <xref:System.String> value to its canonical form.
